item.title: conditions for unilaterized device to be absolutely stable
item.description: The necessary and sufficient conditions for a [[permanent/unilateral device|unilateral device]] to be absolutely stable are: [[Mason’s Invariant U]] is positive and at least one of the two resistances below are positive $R_{11}=Re[Z_{11}]$ $R_{22}=Re[Z_{22}]$ [[Mason’s Invariant U]] is greater than unity (when netiher $R_{11}$ nor $R_{22}$ is positive) Here $[Z]$ is the Z-parameters of the device under study, like a transistor.

item.title: after-action review
item.description: The After-Action Review (AAR) is a simple, powerful framework used by the military and leading corporations to make [[continuous improvement]] by reflecting on each completed action and distilling the relevant insights to inform future actions.

item.title: amplifier output matching for specified power
item.description: In [[permanent/class A linear amplifier]], we saw that there is a specific optimal resistive load that delivers maximum power to the load in a linear class A amplifier.

item.title: amplifier output power with reactive loads
item.description: We found two points on a constant power contour by [[permanent/amplifier output matching for specified power|using two different purely resistive loads]].

item.title: attention residue
item.description: Long stretches of time are required to enter intense focus modes and get [[permanent/deep work]] done, because of attention residue left in the mind when switching over from a previous task.

item.title: Attention span in the workplace
item.description: What is your thought? people want to see the summary first Immediate dompamine hit of wanting to know the answer No slide should be too detailed or it will slip right past the audiences understanding Reduce all complexity to a simple table even if it dilutes the data being represented Is this a consequence of our social media providing instant dopamine hits via twitter, IG and TikTok?

item.title: being driven has become an addiction
item.description: Society celebrates an individual who works faster and faster, trying to cram more tasks into the day, and prioritizing work over all else, and describes such an individual as being “driven”.

item.title: Buckminster Fuller's commonplace book is the most documented human life in history
item.description: The [[Dymaxion]] chronofile is (person:: Buckminster Fuller)’s attempt to document his life as completely as possible. The total collection is estimated to be 270 feet (80 m) worth of paper.

item.title: busyness as a proxy for productivity and prestige
item.description: Due to [[the metric black hole in knowledge work]], being visibly busy by attending meetings, sending emails and messages instantly, and spending a lot of time in shallow work has become a viable option to prove to management that you are productive, even if you have nothing to show for it.

item.title: class A linear amplifier
item.description: Assume that the transistor IV relationship is as shown in the figure below. There is a “linear” characteristic between 0V and 1V, and after 1V, the current is limited to a value Imax.

item.title: Common pitfalls in note taking methods
item.description: 1. Trying to capture every single thought as a note you will need forever You think that every single thought, idea, or concept is equally important and that it is best to file everything away for when you need it.

item.title: Conventional writing methods are flawed right from the start
item.description: The conventional academic research workflow suggests that you first pick a topic to work on, do the necessary research, think about creative solutions, and consolidate your findings in writing.

item.title: create a pre-work ritual
item.description: In order to place an emphasis on [[permanent/Productivity|productivity]], and eliminate the [[permanent/Role of willpower in doing work|need for willpower]] to sink into periods of [[permanent/deep work|deep work]], create a pre-work ritual that eliminates all friction in getting the work done, to emphasize the [[perceived importance of a task]].

item.title: create for one hour each day
item.description: Creating something for one hour each day puts you ahead of most people out there who spend thier time consuming more than creating.

item.title: creative methods of Zhu Da
item.description: (person:: Zhu Da) is a 17th century Chinese artist who would get very drunk, dip his ponytail hair in a bucket of ink, and splash it on a blank canvas.

item.title: creativity is the purest form of self acceptance
item.description: Creativity comes from the uniqueness of your experience, and your own interpretation of reality much like a dress made from the fabric of your own existence.

item.title: deep work
item.description: [!quote] Professional activities performed in a state of distraction-free concentration that push your cognitive capabilities to their limit. These efforts create new value, improve your skill, and are hard to replicate.

item.title: deriving expressions for transit frequency of a MOSFET
item.description: Consider the small signal equivalent circuit of a [[MOSFET]] shown below. We assume here that $V_{BS}=0$, so there are no body currents flowing in the device.

item.title: developing ideas from your note system
item.description: When connecting ideas together either for exploration or for concrete purposes of writing, creating or solving a problem, you will work with your note system to create a first draft.

item.title: developing the art of creative neglect
item.description: Learning to neglect the right things, or the art of creative neglect is a valuable tool that can drive us towards during what is valuable to us, with our time.

item.title: drawing a balance between individual and communal time
item.description: Time is a “networked good”. It is only useful when used in conjunction with others (much like a telephone). Time is not useful if you are have to experience it all by yourself.

item.title: EEHEMT Model Parameters and what they do
item.description: Parameter What it models Vtso subthreshold slope control Vto Threshold voltage n Gate non-ideality factor Is Gate reverse saturation current

item.title: Electrical Engineering
item.description: [[permanent/III-V Device Physics and Modeling|III-V Device Physics and Modeling]] [[permanent/Current Mirror|Current Mirror]]

item.title: emphasize work gestures to increase their importance
item.description: To increase the [[perceived importance of a task]], you can make seemly over-the-top things such as checking into a hotel to do the work, or flying to a remote island to get the work done.

item.title: example design of a unilateralizing network
item.description: It is simple to design a unilaterizing network using passive elements and we can find ways to do it by ensuring that $Z_{12}=0$ of the composite network as required by a [[permanent/unilateral device]].

item.title: facing our limits and finitude
item.description: Momento Mori - Remember that you will die. We are often not reminded of this until we face death in our lives through the loss of someone dear to us.

item.title: get numb before you get good
item.description: If you want to get good at something, then you have to repeat it so many times that you become numb to doing it.

item.title: Glucose is the fundamental means of transporting energy to various parts of the body
item.description: Whenever there is a need for energy in a certain location in the body, it has to be transported to that place on demand.

item.title: Glycolysis in the absence of oxygen
item.description: When there is insufficient oxygen available to the cell during activities such as exercise that pushes muscles to their limit, the cell breaks down glucose into lactic acid as a stop gap measure to produce energy quickly.

item.title: Glycolysis is the breaking down of a glucose molecule
item.description: Glycolysis is the breaking down of glucose by the cell by stripping it of its highest energy electrons and using it to construct NADH (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide + Hydrogen, or coenzyme 1).

item.title: Good workflow design
item.description: A good workflow design should: have a low threshold and be simple to use enable one to use the mind exclusively for thinking, learning, insight, and generation of ideas offload all other aspects of information storage and memory retrieval to an external system allow to jump in and out of lines of thought should differentiate various kinds of tasks and the kinds of attention they deserve make work productive and fun References [[permanent/Zettelkasten example workflow]] [[How to be creative?

item.title: III-V Device Physics and Modeling

item.title: impact of cgd on transit frequency
Impact of finite output resistance on the working of a current mirror
item.description: How well a current source works depends on how the output current depends on the output terminal voltage. We assumed that the output transistor has infinite output impedance, but in reality this is not so, and the collector current usually rises with the collector voltage due to finite output impedance.

item.title: Improved current source with low-gain bipolar devices
item.description: ![[images/bjt-current-source-modified-for-lowgain-bjt.jpeg|400]] When the gain $\beta_f$ of transistors Q1 and Q2 is low, then a modification to the current source is made as shown.

item.title: improving your opportunities for luck
item.description: You can deliberately work on increasing the number of chance encounters, thereby improving opportunities for [[luck]]. This note contains a running list of ways to improve luck on purpose:

item.title: instrumentalizing time
item.description: We have all been told that “time is a precious resource”. As a result of instrumentalizing time, we feel that we have to “use” it in some way to add value to our lives.

item.title: Interpretation of Mason's Invariant U as a Gain Maximum
item.description: [[Mason’s Invariant U]] is the maximum achievable power gain of an amplifer provided that the following conditions are met: The [[Excalidraw/embedding_2port_network.

item.title: issue of reflections in a power matched amplifier
item.description: When using a [[permanent/Loadline match can deliver more output power|loadline match]] (or [[permanent/power match versus conjugate match|power match]] in an RF sense), there is a concern that the load impedance used to extract maximum output power from the power transistor will result in reflections or VSWR issues that will affect the operation of the transistor.

item.title: Loadline match can deliver more output power
item.description: In the absence of any restrictions from the generator or device, conjugate match will deliver the same amount of power as a loadline match.

item.title: lower bound on time to get a task done
item.description: There are certain tasks that take a minimum amount of time to complete successfully. These cannot be rushed, and productivity hacks cannot be applied to finish the task any faster.

item.title: Mechanism of generation of ATP by mitochondria
item.description: The protein protrusions on the external chamber of the mitochondrion capture electrons and pull them into its inner chamber (see [[permanent/Mitochondria and their structure]]).

item.title: metric black hole
item.description: A metric black hole is used to describe something that cannot be quantified effectively, but still has an important impact on the revenue of a business.

item.title: mindset of a creative person alternates between playful and narrow focus modes
item.description: Studies have shown that the most creative people in history switch between wide-open and playful mindsets and narrow, work focused modes of work.

item.title: Mitochondria and their structure
item.description: They are structures believed to have descended from free-floating bacterium that our ancestors injected a long time ago. They do not share the same DNA make-up as humans, but instead they have their own DNA, and co-exist with humans to enable life as we know it.

item.title: Need for Current Mirrors in Microelectronics
item.description: Proper functioning of electronic circuits dictate that the bias circuits are relatively insensitive to external factors such as voltage and temperature variations.

item.title: overcoming existential overwhelm
item.description: Life is too short to enjoy all the infinite experiences it has to offer. It is far better to fully and thoroughly enjoy the small fraction of experiences you actually get to do in your lifetime.

item.title: philosophies of deep work
item.description: There are several philosophies of [[permanent/deep work|deep work]] you can choose from. Monastic If your goals are so well defined that you create value from doing one thing exceptionally well, then this philosophy works best.

item.title: power match versus conjugate match
item.description: Matching a transistor at its output for maximum power output can give significantly higher output power compared to a conjugate match.

item.title: Productivity
item.description: [[permanent/Good workflow design|Good workflow design]] [[permanent/facing our limits and finitude|Time management]]

item.title: reasons why people do not embrace deep work
item.description: Here are some reasons people do not embrace [[permanent/deep work|deep work]]: Principle of least resistance Can get answers immediately via messaging, without prior work planning Setting up weekly sync meetings as a way to keep their own work accountable Busyness as a proxy for productivity With [[permanent/metric black hole|metric black holes]] in knowledge work, it is hard to show you’ve been productive Being visibly busy via email and chat is one way to show you’re working hard The cult of the internet We assume that anything high tech is good for us without considering the consequencies of technology References

item.title: reduced conduction angle - output current derivation
item.description: Compared to a [[permanent/class A linear amplifier|class A amplifier]], the device is biased at a voltage $V_q$, that is closer to cut off.

item.title: Role of willpower in doing work
item.description: Willpower is a quickly depleted resource and it is best to have to use it at all. By using a flexible [[permanent/Good workflow design]], you can choose to not engage willpower at all because your work will provide continuous insights and take you to places you did not imagine before.

item.title: Running ICCAP simulation with ADS PDK
item.description: If you want to use a foundry provided ADS PDK in the ICCAP circuit tab to setup model validations for devices in ICCAP, which is often the case with GaAs foundries which almost exclusively deal with ADS PDKs, the procedure to do so is described below.

item.title: Running Transient AC Analysis
item.description: Let’s say that you have to run [[s-parameter]] simulation as a function of time, where conditions such as voltages are changing in the window of time, then you need to run the AC simulation at every time point that is of interest.

item.title: Setting up Borgmatic for backups
item.description: [[Borgmatic]] is a wrapper for Install borg Create a virtual environment for borg virtualenv --python=python3 borg-env Activate the borg env source borg-env/bin/activate

item.title: shallow work
item.description: [!quote] Noncognitively demanding, logistical-style tasks, often performed while distracted. These efforts tend to not create much new value in the world and are easy to replicate.

item.title: stick with it long enough for originality to emerge
item.description: [!quote] Originality lies on the far side of unoriginality -Oliver Burkeman, Four thousand weeks. To create original work takes time, and is often the result of doing something far longer than others will tolerate and accepting the discomfort of not being in control throughout.

item.title: The Barbell Method of Reading
item.description: Read on Omnivore Read Original The Barbell Method is a phrase coined by Nassim Taleb. ⤴️ The Barbell Method takes this into account by integrating your reading habit into your [[personal knowledge management]] with two steps:

item.title: the best way to learn is through action
item.description: People try to learn everything they can about YouTube, before making their first video. People try to read everything about business before starting their first business.

item.title: The Bottom’s Up Approach To Writing That 99% Guarantees A Successful Article
item.description: The Bottom’s Up Approach To Writing That 99% Guarantees A Successful Article #Omnivore Read on Omnivore Read Original Highlights Most writers have two problems that stop them from creating consistent content.

item.title: The importance of writing for learning, understanding, thinking and retention
item.description: Writing is the best way to ensure that you are thinking about what you’re reading, and not simply hearing the author’s voice in your head.

item.title: The Parable of the Thanksgiving Turkey
item.description: The Parable of the Thanksgiving Turkey comes from The Black Swan, the 2007 best selling non-fiction book by Nassim Taleb about unforseen events.

item.title: the time billionaire
item.description: Graham Duncan, the co-founder of East Rock Capital, appeared on an episode of The Tim Ferriss Show. During the conversation, Duncan proposed a concept: The Time Billionaire.

item.title: The Warburg Effect is a phenomenon where cancerous cells behave as if they are in a metabolic emergency
item.description: The Warburg Effect is a phenomenon that occurs almost universally among all cancer cells, where the cells behave as if they are deprived of oxygen (even if they are not) and are in a state of metabolic energy where energy needs to be produced immediately by breaking down glucose into lactic acid, a process of fermentation, much like what happens in muscles when they are pushed to their limit during exercise.

item.title: Thevenin voltage as a figure of merit for current source performance
item.description: The open-circuit equivalent voltage given by the Thevenin equivalent representation is the figure of merit for a current source. The higher the open circuit voltage, the better.

item.title: time spent with people in our lifetime
item.description: ![[permanent/Pasted image 20230427055022.png]] ![[permanent/Pasted image 20230427055037.png]] ![[permanent/Pasted image 20230427055046.png]] References American Time use survey: https://www.bls.gov/news.release/atus.toc.htm [[permanent/the time billionaire]] [[permanent/instrumentalizing time as a resource]]

item.title: transit frequency basics
item.description: Transit frequency fT is a measure of the intrinsic speed of a transistor and is defined as: [!important] fT is the frequency at which the small signal current gain of the device becomes unity

item.title: treating music composition as a routine chore
item.description: [[permanent/Conventional writing methods are flawed right from the start|Much like in academic writing]], never start music composition from a blank slate.

item.title: unilateral device
item.description: A unilateral two-port device is one that has no reverse transmission of signals, from the output port to the input port.

item.title: Using a current mirror to create multiple copies, multiples, or fractions of a reference current
item.description: Once the base / gate voltage is generated from the reference current $I_{ref}$ generated by a [[Band Gap Reference]] circuit, it can be used to create multiple copies of the current of higher, lower or equal values.

item.title: Using a work journal to create design case studies
item.description: Using a work journal to create design case studies #Omnivore Read on Omnivore Read Original Highlights Anything from setting and evaluating common goals for yourself or capturing a message about a challenging interaction with a co-worker are great uses of a work journal.

item.title: Using the zettelkasten method to produce written work
item.description: Always externalize your thoughts, inputs and interpretations in written form, as a collection of notes that will form the external scaffolding needed for your brain to generate ideas Use fleeting notes to capture any thought that comes up to the mind.

item.title: using zettelkasten for music composition
item.description: What is your thought? Use the zettelkasten slip-box system to enhace productivity in writing music What inspired this thought? Reading [[literature/B-Ahrens-2017]] led me to think that academic writing is not all that different from music writing.

item.title: Value of an idea depends on its context
item.description: If you have an idea that is related to a topic that you are working on, it often has other applications in areas that you still have not considered.

item.title: Way to improve settling time in floating body LNAs
item.description: Why does the [[LNA]] settle slowly? There is no way for the charges in the body to be removed from a floating body device.

item.title: ways to improve learning, retention and understanding while reading
item.description: Always read with a pen (or keyboard) in hand. The end goal is to create permanent notes in the slipbox Elaborate in your own words what you have understood from reading Make it as detailed as it needs to be Technical texts can be very detailed Self help books can be reduced to a sentence Teach the subject to your future self Include sufficient detail that it will make sense later Test your self on the material and think beyond the text Elaboration is a way of testing your understanding Identify how it connects to what you already know Practice extracting the gist from reading something Be it a paragraph, section or chapter, step back and ask yourself what was just explained to you Ask what is not being said too Don’t hear the author’s voice in your head; learn to think as you read and develop your own inner voice Capture all information from what you read, and not just what you agree with Create abstractions from what you read to a context that is more general than the one you encountered an idea in.

item.title: what it means to get rest
item.description: Aristotle argued that true leisure is self-reflection and philosophical contemplation is the highest of virtues and worth choosing for its own sake.

item.title: why city life makes us grumpy
item.description: The longer we continuously live in the city, the more we feel the need to “getaway” from it, and we then take vacations to “slow-down” and recover ourselves.

item.title: work strategies for successful writing
item.description: Do not multi-task. Dedicate your focus on the task. Different kinds of reading (textbook, blog, article, etc) and different aspects of writing (draft, writing, proof, etc) require different kinds of attention.

item.title: Working principle of a Current Mirror
item.description: A [[permanent/Current Mirror]] copies the golden reference current $I_{ref}$ generated by a [[Band Gap Reference]] circuit. Circuit Diagram ![[images/bjt-current-source.jpeg|400]] Explanation The purpose of transistor Q1 is to generate an output voltage at its base that is proportional to the input current at the collector.

item.title: Zettelkasten example workflow
item.description: For a beginner getting started with zettelkasten note-taking, the following steps will serve as a quick start guide. Take fleeting notes in any medium in a stream-of-conciousness style that captures all relevant ideas from the source.

item.title: 🔭 A Simple Format To Distil What You Learn
item.description: 🔭 A Simple Format To Distil What You Learn #Omnivore Read on Omnivore Read Original Highlights A structure would make writing the [[newsletter]] easier as I could work within the constraints of the headings to guide what I wrote about.
